## Importing the data

For this, I will use the R package "gtrendsR" for the first time. 

```{r installation, echo=TRUE, results='hide', warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library("dplyr")
library("readr")
library("gtrendsR")
library("googlesheets4")
```


```{r importing data, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
covid_data<-read_csv("Covid19_Canada_March26.csv", skip=3)
```

```{r getting dates}
covid_data %>%
  filter(provincial_case_id==100) %>%
  select(province, date_report)
```
So Ontario had its 100th case on March 14th, BC on March 16th, Alberta on March 18th and Quebec on March 19th.

```{r example trend}
dp<-gtrends(c("corona virus"), time="today 1-m", geo = c("CA-ON","CA-BC","CA-QC"))
plot(dp)
```
